common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues Across Multiple Applications
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty connecting various applications (VS Code, Chrome/Edge extensions, Desktop app) to Pieces OS.  Common symptoms include connection hangs, leaks, and inability to register MCP tools.  Suggested solutions include checking Pieces OS and app versions, verifying network configurations (VPN, proxy), monitoring connections, restarting Pieces OS or the affected application, and ensuring the Pieces Desktop app is closed if causing connection leaks.

related_issues.title: MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
related_issues.text:
MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The Pieces MCP server fails to properly integrate with Claude Code within VSCode. While the SSE endpoint responds initially, it hangs indefinitely, preventing MCP tools from being registered or used. This affects Claude Code integration both as a standalone CLI and when used within VS Code.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install Pieces OS and Pieces app
2. Login in the app
3. Configure MCP in Claude Code's ~/.claude.json:

```json
{
  "pieces": {
    "type": "sse",
    "url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse"
}
```

4. Attempt to use Pieces MCP tools (e.g., mcp__pieces__ask_pieces_ltm) in Claude Code
5. Tools are not available despite server being configured
6. Same issue occurs whether using Claude Code in terminal or integrated with VS Code

**Technical Details:**
- SSE endpoint (http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse) responds with:

```
event: endpoint
data: /model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages
```

- Connection then hangs indefinitely (SSE buffering issue)
- Both Pieces OS and Pieces app processes are running
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS, Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.3.1 and Pieces OS 12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have pieces MCP server installed in my Windows vscode. Snippet below. I had issues with it stopping suddenly. With help of vscode github copilot we determined that it was connections were used up. Investigation yielded that when Pieces Desktop not running only two connections present. When I started Pieces Desktop connections jumped to 50.  Below the MCP config snippet is copy of github copilot working session.

"pieces": {
	"url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse",
	"type": "http",
	"gallery": true,
	"autoStart": false,
	"timeout": 30000,
	"retryDelay": 5000,
	"maxRetries": 3
}

I have started pieces desktop app. I informed it of our changes which it concurs. Can you check connection status and health of pieces now that I have stared pieces desktop?

I'll check the connection status and health of the Pieces MCP server now that you've started the Pieces desktop app.

⚠️ The connection leak problem is back! Let me check which processes are involved:

Problem Identified! 🚨
The issue is that starting the Pieces Desktop app (pieces_for_x.exe) has re-created the connection leak problem:

Process 35956: os_server.exe (Pieces OS) - listening on port 39300
Process 29660: Code.exe (VS Code) - 1 connection (good)
Process 37316: pieces_for_x.exe (Pieces Desktop) - 50+ connections (bad!)

The Root Cause:
The Pieces Desktop application itself has a connection leak bug - it's creating excessive connections to the Pieces OS server, just like we saw before with VS Code.

Solutions:
Option 1: Temporary Fix (Close Pieces Desktop)
Option 2: Keep Pieces Desktop but Monitor
If you need the Pieces Desktop app running, you can:

Monitor connections periodically
Restart Pieces OS periodically to clear leaks
Report this as a bug to Pieces support
Let's check if closing the desktop app fixed the connections:

Perfect! Now let's test the MCP connection:

pieces (MCP Server)
Connection Status: ✅ HEALTHY!
Perfect! The Pieces MCP server is now working correctly with excellent connection health:

Current Status:
✅ 2 established connections (down from 50+)
✅ MCP server responding successfully
✅ Clean connection state with minimal overhead
✅ No connection leaks
Root Cause Confirmed:
The issue was specifically with the Pieces Desktop application (pieces_for_x.exe) creating excessive connections. The Pieces OS (os_server.exe) and VS Code MCP integration work fine together.

Current Working Configuration:
Pieces OS: Running and healthy
VS Code MCP: Connected with proper timeout settings
Pieces Desktop: Stopped (to prevent connection leaks)
Today's Work Context Retrieved:
From the MCP response, I can see you're actively working on:

Database Mapping Projects:

GWM-22316: Map database tables to GWMS UI elements
GWM-22318: Customer SVP database migration
Customer and facility screen analysis
Development Tools:

VS Code with MCP integration
Oracle SQL Developer for database work
Time tracking with Toggl and Clockk
Recent Focus Areas:

Vite platform work
Keycloak maintenance
Research flow documentation with LLMs
Recommendation:
Keep the current setup as-is:

✅ Use Pieces OS for the MCP integration (working perfectly)
⚠️ Avoid Pieces Desktop until they fix the connection leak bug
✅ Monitor connections occasionally with netstat if needed
The MCP integration is now stable and providing excellent work context tracking without the connection leak issues!

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Bugs in Pieces OS 12.1.1 on Windows Desktop
common_issues.description: Multiple users report issues with Pieces OS 12.1.1 on Windows. These include problems copying code blocks (inline and inter-line), sharing snippets via links or GitHub gists, and dragging files into the conversation context.  Additional issues involve file choosing window behavior and file filtering limitations.

related_issues.title: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !!
related_issues.text: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !! ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. 1. The 2nd pic below do not function properly: The description of this problem only requires one line equation, and inequality of graphics: - it should be: Copy copilot message ≠ Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) = Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) - however: = ≠ - how could Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) ? absolute wrong. - it should be like: Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) by design. 2. Copy improperly: if one copies `in-line code block` through ctrl+c (rather than the "copy button" provided alongside), it is very likely (coupled with double click) to paste it into " ￼ ". 3. Feature: Hopefully, the `in-line code block` can be partially copied (rather than merely allowing all copies) like the inter-line code block to improve efficiency. common_issues.title: Pieces OS and related software connectivity and sharing issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS and related software (Desktop App, browser extensions) including: Personal domain displaying as null.pieces.cloud, browser extensions failing to connect to Pieces OS, and inability to share snippets via link or GitHub gist.  Issues appear across Windows and may be related to VPN usage or recent upgrades. Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and solutions.

related_issues.title: Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS leads to null.pieces.cloud
related_issues.text: Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS leads to null.pieces.cloud ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Hi, If I edit the username of my personal domain, it takes a couple of minutes before it's named "null.pieces.cloud." It doesn't matter whether the username contains only letters or a combination of letters and numbers. No spaces or uppercase letters are used. I'm using the Desktop App Version 4.3.1 Regards Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection issues across multiple platforms
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing connection issues with Pieces OS on Windows, including the desktop app, VS Code extension, and browser extensions.  A connection leak was identified with the desktop app creating excessive connections to the OS server.  Browser extensions are also failing to connect, potentially due to VPN conflicts.  Suggested solutions include closing the desktop app, monitoring connections, restarting the OS server, and investigating VPN settings for browser extensions.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS, Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.3.1 and Pieces OS 12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have pieces MCP server installed in my Windows vscode. Snippet below. I had issues with it stopping suddenly. With help of vscode github copilot we determined that it was connections were used up. Investigation yielded that when Pieces Desktop not running only two connections present. When I started Pieces Desktop connections jumped to 50.  Below the MCP config snippet is copy of github copilot working session.

"pieces": {
	"url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse",
	"type": "http",
	"gallery": true,
	"autoStart": false,
	"timeout": 30000,
	"retryDelay": 5000,
	"maxRetries": 3
}

I have started pieces desktop app. I informed it of our changes which it concurs. Can you check connection status and health of pieces now that I have stared pieces desktop?

I'll check the connection status and health of the Pieces MCP server now that you've started the Pieces desktop app.

⚠️ The connection leak problem is back! Let me check which processes are involved:

Problem Identified! 🚨
The issue is that starting the Pieces Desktop app (pieces_for_x.exe) has re-created the connection leak problem:

Process 35956: os_server.exe (Pieces OS) - listening on port 39300
Process 29660: Code.exe (VS Code) - 1 connection (good)
Process 37316: pieces_for_x.exe (Pieces Desktop) - 50+ connections (bad!)

The Root Cause:
The Pieces Desktop application itself has a connection leak bug - it's creating excessive connections to the Pieces OS server, just like we saw before with VS Code.

Solutions:
Option 1: Temporary Fix (Close Pieces Desktop)
Option 2: Keep Pieces Desktop but Monitor
If you need the Pieces Desktop app running, you can:

Monitor connections periodically
Restart Pieces OS periodically to clear leaks
Report this as a bug to Pieces support
Let's check if closing the desktop app fixed the connections:

Perfect! Now let's test the MCP connection:

pieces (MCP Server)
Connection Status: ✅ HEALTHY!
Perfect! The Pieces MCP server is now working correctly with excellent connection health:

Current Status:
✅ 2 established connections (down from 50+)
✅ MCP server responding successfully
✅ Clean connection state with minimal overhead
✅ No connection leaks
Root Cause Confirmed:
The issue was specifically with the Pieces Desktop application (pieces_for_x.exe) creating excessive connections. The Pieces OS (os_server.exe) and VS Code MCP integration work fine together.

Current Working Configuration:
Pieces OS: Running and healthy
VS Code MCP: Connected with proper timeout settings
Pieces Desktop: Stopped (to prevent connection leaks)
Today's Work Context Retrieved:
From the MCP response, I can see you're actively working on:

Database Mapping Projects:

GWM-22316: Map database tables to GWMS UI elements
GWM-22318: Customer SVP database migration
Customer and facility screen analysis
Development Tools:

VS Code with MCP integration
Oracle SQL Developer for database work
Time tracking with Toggl and Clockk
Recent Focus Areas:

Vite platform work
Keycloak maintenance
Research flow documentation with LLMs
Recommendation:
Keep the current setup as-is:

✅ Use Pieces OS for the MCP integration (working perfectly)
⚠️ Avoid Pieces Desktop until they fix the connection leak bug
✅ Monitor connections occasionally with netstat if needed
The MCP integration is now stable and providing excellent work context tracking without the connection leak issues!

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Service and Workstream Summary Errors
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces Copilot Service and Workstream Summary generation.  Copilot Service shows 'Instance of 'fp'' error. Workstream Summary shows 'ApiException 511' related to an application in local mode. Potential solutions include updating Pieces OS to the supported version (11.2.2-12.0.0 or 12.1.0-13.0.0 respectively) and ensuring applications are not in local mode for Workstream Summary.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving connectivity issues between Pieces OS, Desktop App, and browser extensions, especially focusing on connection leaks and VPN conflicts.
Address bugs in Pieces OS 12.1.1 on Windows, particularly those related to code copying, sharing snippets, and file handling.
Investigate and resolve issues with Pieces Copilot Service ('Instance of 'fp'' error) and Workstream Summary generation ('ApiException 511' error).
Update documentation or user interface to clarify supported Pieces OS versions for Copilot Service and Workstream Summary and instructions for resolving local mode conflicts.
Improve communication with users experiencing connectivity and sharing issues, providing temporary workarounds and updates on progress towards solutions.
